# playInputClick()

**Instance Method**

Plays an input click in an enabled input view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func playInputClick()
```

## Discussion

Use this method to play the standard system keyboard click in response to a user tapping in a custom input or keyboard accessory view. A click plays only if the user has enabled keyboard clicks in Settings > Sounds, and only if the input view is itself enabled and visible.

To enable a custom input or accessory view for input clicks, perform the following two steps:

1. Adopt the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIInputViewAudioFeedback] protocol in your input view class.
2. Implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIInputViewAudioFeedback/enableInputClicksWhenVisible] delegate method to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/StringsTextFonts/Conceptual/TextAndWebiPhoneOS/Introduction/Introduction.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40009542].
